instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01958-A
threads.message:
No liquid damage. T2 is getting a little hot. :(

It draws 0.08 amps.


PPBUS_G3H : 12.30 Volt
PP5V_G3S : No Voltage
PP3V3_G3H_RTC : No Voltage

threads.title: 820-01958-A
threads.message:
pin 11 :  12.30 Voltage
pin 10 :  12.30 Voltage
pin 13 :  5 Voltage
pin 5 :  0.8 Voltage

threads.title: 820-01958-A
threads.message:
Check R6970-73.
If all good, replace U6960.

threads.title: 820-01958-A
threads.message: Is T2 heating normal in this case?

threads.title: 820-01958-A
threads.message: Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?
